alert.note: Alert for Coastal Onslow; West Carteret (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 22 at 8:37PM EDT until September 23 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT FRIDAY... ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM EDT FRIDAY THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 6 to 8 feet in the surf zone. For the Beach Hazards Statement, dangerous rip currents and large breaking waves expected in the surf zone. * WHERE...Crystal Coast beaches. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 2 PM EDT Friday. For the Beach Hazards Statement, from 8 AM EDT Friday through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. Dangerous shore break can throw a swimmer or surfer head first into the bottom causing neck and back injuries.
info.instruction: Life-threatening rip currents and dangerous shore break. Swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
